content: I’m Currently a third year PhD student working under professor Natalia Ivanova at the University of Alberta. My Current research focuses on testing a more generalized and improved magnetic braking prescription described in Pavlovskii et al. 2015. Using MESA  and the resources provided by Compute Canada , I simulate a grid of initial binaries and compare the results to observed systems.
summary: I’m Currently a third year PhD student working under professor Natalia Ivanova at the University of Alberta. My Current research focuses on testing a more generalized and improved magnetic braking prescription described in Pavlovskii et al. 2015. Using MESA  and the resources provided by Compute Canada , I simulate a grid of initial binaries and compare the results to observed systems.
title: Kenny X. Van

summary: A systematic comparison of different magnetic braking schemes using the MESA stellar evolution code.
title: Low-mass X-ray binaries: the effects of the magnetic braking prescription

summary: A possible formation channel of low mass X-ray binaries involving a black hole and a stripped sub-giant donor.
title: Formation of Black Hole X-Ray Binaries with Non-degenerate Donors in Globular Clusters

summary: A study looking at the stability of mass transfer in binaries with a massive donor and black hole companion.
title: Stability of mass transfer from massive giants: double black hole binary formation and ultraluminous X-ray sources

summary: A poster presentation showing the results from the paper Stability of mass transfer from massive giants: double black hole binary formation and ultraluminous X-ray sources.
title: Stability of Mass Transfer From Massive Giants
